name.en: Seminar on Contemporary Trends of Western Philosophy
name.ch: 當代西方哲學思潮專題

goal.en: 1. Improve students’ understanding of the contemporary French philosophy; 2. Introduce structural concept in the contemporary French philosophy; 3. Discuss the tensions between Reason and Non-Reason.
goal.ch: 1. 增進學生對於當代法國哲學的了解。 2. 介紹當代法國哲學中的結構概念派。 3. 討論理性與非理性之間的張力。

content.en:
The aim of Michel Foucault’s Madness and Civilization is not to take over doctors’ jobs in diagnosing patients’ symptoms nor to trace the origin of madness. The aim instead is to discuss the tensions between Reason and Non-Reason of madness, accompanied by various discussions around literature, arts, medicine, religion, and social economy.
The discourse about madness did not start in the 17th century, although Foucault sets the time period between the 17th and 19th centuries for his book. For this reason, he traces the concept and discussions about madness back to the Middle Ages and even to Ancient Greece, which gives the reason why there is a large number of historical documents in this oeuvre.
The objective of this course will not only lead students to read this great oeuvre faithfully but also introduce and discuss the debate between Foucault and his student Jacques Derrida on the explanation of madness in Descartes’ work.
content.ch:
法國哲學家傅柯的這部作品，並不在於代替臨床醫生診斷病患瘋狂與否，也不在於建立一套認定標準，更不是追溯此病的起因。而在於討論古典時代的「瘋狂」的概念與理性之間的種種張力，中間伴隨著文學、藝術、醫學、宗教以及經濟社會等論述。
儘管傅柯將時代標定為十七到十九世紀，但有關「瘋狂」的論述並非僅起自十七世紀，為此，傅柯回溯至中世紀，甚至分析起了希臘時期哲學家們對瘋狂問題的討論，這也是為什麼此書有大量的歷史文獻的原因。
本課程除了帶領同學忠實地閱讀傅柯此一鉅著之外，也將討論此書引起的師生論辯，即作為學生的德希達對昔日師長在書中對於笛卡爾詮釋的挑戰。

textbook.en: 1. Jacques Derrida, Writing and Difference, translated by Alan Bass, Press of University Chicago, 1967. 2. René Descartes, Meditations on First Philosophy, edited by John Cottingham and Bernard Williams, Cambridge University Press, 2017.
textbook.ch: 1. Jacques Derrida,《書寫與差異》，張寧 譯，麥田出版社，台灣台北，2004年。 2. René Descartes,《第一哲學沈思錄》，龐景仁 譯，商務出版，中國北京，2006年。 3. Michel Foucault, 《古典時代瘋狂史》，林志明 譯，時報出版社，台灣台北，2016年。 辯，即作為學生的德希達對昔日師長在書中對於笛卡爾詮釋的挑戰。
